workspace-name.description: Metadata: A name to describe the entire workspace.

workspace-version.description: Metadata: A version to give to the entire workspace.

workspace-description.description: Metadata: A description for the workspace.

workspace-homepage.description: Metadata: A homepage URL for the workspace.

workspace-author.description: Metadata: An individual or business entity involved in creating or maintaining the workspace.

workspace-license.description: Metadata: A license identifier or text file path that describes how people are permitted or restricted to use this workspace.

workspace-readme.description: Metadata: A path to the readme file of the workspace.

configuration.description: Properties to describe a single build configuration type.

configuration-debugSymbols.description:
true to include debug symbols, false otherwise.
In GNU-based compilers, this is equivalent to the `-g3` option (`-g` & macro information expansion) and forces `-O0` if the optimizationLevel is not `0` or `debug`.
In MSVC, this enables `/debug`, `/incremental` and forces `/Od` if the optimizationLevel is not `0` or `debug`.
Additionally, `_DEBUG` will be defined in `*-pc-windows-msvc` targets.
This flag is also the determining factor whether the `:debug` suffix is used in a chalet.json property.

configuration-enableProfiling.description:
true to enable profiling for this configuration, false otherwise.
In GNU-based compilers, this is equivalent to the `-pg` option
In MSVC, this adds the `/debug:FULL` and `/profile` options.
If profiling is enabled and the project is run, a compatible profiler application will be launched when the program is run.

configuration-interproceduralOptimizatio.description:
true to use interprocedural optimizations, false otherwise.
In GCC, this enables link-time optimizations - the equivalent to passing the `-flto` & `-fno-fat-lto-objects` options to the compiler, and `-flto` to the linker.
In MSVC, this performs whole program optimizations - the equivalent to passing `/GL` to cl.exe and `/LTCG` to link.exe and lib.exe
In Clang, so far, this does nothing.

configuration-optimizationLevel.description:
The optimization level of the build.
In GNU-based compilers, This maps 1:1 with its respective `-O` option, except for debug - `-Od` and size - `-Os`.
In MSVC, it's mapped as follows: 0 - `/Od`, 1 - `/O1`, 2 - `/O2`, 3 - `/Ox`, size - `/Os`, fast - `/Ot`, debug - `/Od`
If this value is unset, no optimization level will be used (implying the compiler's default).

configuration-sanitize.description: An array of sanitizers to enable. If combined with staticRuntimeLibrary, the selected sanitizers will be statically linked, if available by the toolchain.

dist-kind.description: Whether the distribution target is a bundle, script, archive, or something platform-specific.

dist-condition.description: A rule describing when to include this target in the distribution.

dist-bundle.description: Properties to describe an individual bundle.

kind.description: Whether the distribution target is a bundle, script, archive, or something platform-specific.

windows.description: Properties applicable to Windows application distribution.

includeRuntimeDlls.description: If true, include the Windows UCRT dlls if 'staticRuntimeLibrary' is set to false by the build target. false to exclude them (default). This only applies if 'includeDependentSharedLibraries' is set to true

linuxDesktopEntry.description: Properties to describe an XDG Desktop Entry.

copyToApplications.description: If true, the desktop entry file will be copied to '~/.local/share/applications' (if it exists on the distro) so it can be found locally.

icon.description: The location to an icon to use with the XDG Desktop Entry (PNG 256x256 is recommended)

template.description: The location to an XDG Desktop Entry template. If the file does not exist, a basic one will be generated in its place.

macosBundle.description: Properties to describe the MacOS bundle.

copyToApplications.description: If true, the app bundle will be copied to '~/Applications' so it can be found locally by Launchpad.

entitlementsPropertyList.description: The path to a property list (.xml) file, .json file, or the properties themselves to describe the entitlements required to run the app. Only applies to codesigned bundles

icon.description:
The path to a MacOS bundle icon formatted as either a PNG (1024x1024 is recommended), ICNS or ICONSET.
It will get converted to .icns during the bundle process.

iconMethod.description: The method to use to create the app bundle icon. The default method is to use 'actool' and fallback to 'sips' if 'actool' is not available on the machine (the case with Command Line Tools). Set to 'sips' to always use sips. The 'xcodebuild' strategy will use actool.

infoPropertyList.description: The path to a property list (.plist) file, .json file, or the properties themselves to export as a plist defining the bundle.

type.description: The MacOS bundle type (only `.app` is supported currently)

dist-bundle-exclude.description:
In folder paths that are included with `include`, exclude certain files or paths.
Can accept a glob pattern.

dist-bundle-include.description:
A list of files or folders to copy into the output directory of the bundle.
In MacOS, these will be placed into the `Resources` folder of the application bundle.

dist-bundle-mainExecutable.description:
The name of the main executable project target.
If this property is not defined, the first executable in the `buildTargets` array of the bundle will be chosen as the main executable.

dist-bundle-subdirectory.description: The sub-directory to be placed inside of the `dist` directory (it not otherwise changed) to place this bundle along with all of its included resources and shared libraries.

dist-bundle-buildTargets.description:
Either an array of build target names to include in this bundle. A single string value of `*` will include all build targets.
If `mainExecutable` is not defined, the first executable target in this list will be chosen as the main executable.

dist-bundle-includeDependentSharedLibrar.description: If true (default), any shared libraries that the bundle depends on will also be copied.

kind.description: Whether the distribution target is a bundle, script, archive, or something platform-specific.

dist-script-dependsOn.description: A distribution target this script depends on in order to run.

kind.description: Whether the distribution target is a bundle, script, archive, or something platform-specific.

dist-process-dependsOn.description: A distribution target this process depends on in order to run.

dist-validation.description: Validate JSON file(s) against a schema. Unlike with build validation target, all files will always validate.

kind.description: Whether the distribution target is a bundle, script, archive, or something platform-specific.

dist-archive.description: Properties to describe an individual distribution archive.

kind.description: Whether the distribution target is a bundle, script, archive, or something platform-specific.

dist-archive-format.description: The archive format to use. If not specified, `zip` will be used.

dist-archive-include.description: A list of files or folders to add to the archive, relative to the root distribution directory. Glob patterns are also accepted. A single string value of `*` will archive everything in the bundle directory.

dist-archive-macosNotarizationProfile.description: The keychain profile to use for notarization on macos. Requires Xcode 13 or higher

dist-macos-disk-image.description: Properties to describe a macos disk image (dmg). Implies 'condition: macos'

background.description: Either a single path to a TIFF or a PNG background image, or paths to 1x/2x PNG background images.

1x.description: The path to a background image in PNG format created for 1x pixel density.

2x.description: The path to a background image in PNG format created for 2x pixel density.

kind.description: Whether the distribution target is a bundle, script, archive, or something platform-specific.

positions.description:
Icon positions for the root disk image paths.
Specifying the name of a bundle will include it in the image. Specifying `Applications` will include a symbolic link to the `/Applications` path.
Additionally, if there is a bundle named `Applications`, it will be ignored, and an error will be displayed.

^[\\w\\-+. ()]{2,}$.description: An icon position in the root disk image.

x.description: The x position of the path's icon

y.description: The y position of the path's icon

size.description: The visible window dimensions of the disk image.

width.description: The width of the disk image

height.description: The height of the disk image

dist-macos-disk-image-pathbarVisible.description: true to display the pathbar (aka breadcrumbs) in the root of the disk image. false to hide it.

dist-macos-disk-image-iconSize.description: The icon size in the root of the disk image.

dist-macos-disk-image-textSize.description: The text size in the root of the disk image.

dist-macos-disk-image-background.description: Either a single path to a TIFF or a PNG background image, or paths to 1x/2x PNG background images.

1x.description: The path to a background image in PNG format created for 1x pixel density.

2x.description: The path to a background image in PNG format created for 2x pixel density.

external-dependency-kind.description: Whether the external dependency is a git repository, local folder, or script.

external-dependency-condition.description: A rule describing when to include this dependency during the build. Only accepts env and platform variables.

kind.description: Whether the external dependency is a git repository, local folder, or script.

external-dependency-git-repository.description: The url of the git repository.

external-dependency-git-branch.description: The git branch to checkout. Uses the repository's default if not set.

external-dependency-git-commit.description: The SHA1 hash of the git commit to checkout.

external-dependency-git-tag.description: The tag to checkout on the selected git branch. If it's blank or not found, the head of the branch will be checked out.

external-dependency-git-submodules.description: Do submodules need to be cloned?

kind.description: Whether the external dependency is a git repository, local folder, or script.

external-dependency-local-path.description: The local path to a dependency to build from. Can take `env` and `var` substitution variables. (ie. `${env:SOME_PATH}`)

kind.description: Whether the external dependency is a git repository, local folder, or script.

variables.description: Local variables to be used inside of the build file, but shouldn't be part of the environment (.env) - ie. shortcuts to paths that may otherwise be verbose.

variable-value.description: The value to assign to an environment variable

searchPaths.description: Any additional search paths to include. Accepts Chalet variables such as ${buildDir} & ${external:(name)}

packagePaths.description: Additional paths to search for packages. Can either be a path containing a build file or the path to the build file itself. If the resolved build files does not contain a 'package' declaration, it will be ignored.

target-outputDescription.description: A description of the target to display in the build output.

target-kind.description: The type of the target's compiled binary, a script or external project.

target-condition.description: A rule describing when to include this target in the build.

target-defaultRunArguments.description: If this is the run target, a string of arguments to pass to the run command.

target-source-executable.description: Build a target from source files.

kind.description: The type of the target's compiled binary, a script or external project.

target-source-library.description: Build a target from source files.

kind.description: The type of the target's compiled binary, a script or external project.

target-source-extends.description:
An abstract source target template to extend from. Defaults to `*` implicitly.
 If `abstracts:*` is not defined, then effectively, nothing is extended.

target-source-files.description: Define the source files, relative to the working directory.

target-source-language.description: The desired programming language of the project.

target-source-configureFiles.description:
A list of files to copy into an intermediate build folder, which may include susbstitution variables formatted as either `@VAR` or `${VAR}`. These refer to metadata values at the workspace level or at the source target (project) level. They will be replaced with the variables' value, or an empty string if not recognized. Some backwards compatibility with CMake configure files are supported for convenience.
The variables are:
`WORKSPACE_NAME` `WORKSPACE_DESCRIPTION` `WORKSPACE_AUTHOR` `WORKSPACE_HOMEPAGE_URL` `WORKSPACE_LICENSE` `WORKSPACE_README` `WORKSPACE_VERSION` `WORKSPACE_VERSION_MAJOR` `WORKSPACE_VERSION_MINOR` `WORKSPACE_VERSION_PATCH` `WORKSPACE_VERSION_TWEAK`
`PROJECT_NAME` `PROJECT_DESCRIPTION` `PROJECT_AUTHOR` `PROJECT_HOMEPAGE_URL` `PROJECT_LICENSE` `PROJECT_README` `PROJECT_VERSION` `PROJECT_VERSION_MAJOR` `PROJECT_VERSION_MINOR` `PROJECT_VERSION_PATCH` `PROJECT_VERSION_TWEAK`
`CMAKE_PROJECT_NAME` `CMAKE_PROJECT_DESCRIPTION` `CMAKE_PROJECT_AUTHOR` `CMAKE_PROJECT_HOMEPAGE_URL` `CMAKE_PROJECT_LICENSE` `CMAKE_PROJECT_README` `CMAKE_PROJECT_VERSION` `CMAKE_PROJECT_VERSION_MAJOR` `CMAKE_PROJECT_VERSION_MINOR` `CMAKE_PROJECT_VERSION_PATCH` `CMAKE_PROJECT_VERSION_TWEAK`

`CMAKE_PROJECT_` variables are equivalent to `WORKSPACE_` so using them is a matter of compatibility and preference.

target-copyFilesOnRun.description: If this is the run target, a list of files that should be copied into the build folder before running. This is primarily meant for libraries that need to be resolved from the same directory as the run target. In the case of MacOS bundles, these will be copied inside the `MacOS` folder path alongside the executable.

target-source-importPackages.description: Packages to import into the source target.

target-source-metadata.description:
Metadata to assign to source targets that can be retrieved with the `PROJECT_` prefix within configure files.
(See: `configureFiles`)

target-source-metadata-name.description: A name to describe the build target.

target-source-metadata-version.description: A version to give to the build target.

target-source-metadata-description.description: A description for the build target.

target-source-metadata-homepage.description: A homepage URL for the build target.

target-source-metadata-author.description: An individual or business entity involved in creating or maintaining the build target.

target-source-metadata-license.description: A license identifier or text file path that describes how people are permitted or restricted to use this build target.

target-source-metadata-readme.description: A path to the readme file of the build target.

target-source-cxx.description:
Settings for compiling C, C++, and Windows resource files.
May also include settings related to linking.

target-source-cxx-cStandard.description: The C standard to use in the compilation

target-source-cxx-cppStandard.description: The C++ standard to use during compilation

target-source-cxx-compileOptions.description: Addtional options per compiler type (via property conditions) to add during the compilation step.

target-source-cxx-defines.description: Macro definitions to be used by the preprocessor

target-source-cxx-includeDirs.description: A list of directories to include during compilation.

target-source-cxx-libDirs.description: Fallback search paths to look for static or dynamic libraries (`/usr/lib` is included by default)

target-source-cxx-linkerOptions.description: Addtional options per compiler type (via property conditions) to add during the linking step.

target-source-cxx-links.description: A list of dynamic links to use with the linker. Can be the name of the source target, a link identifier (no extension), or the full relative path to a static or dynamic library.

target-source-cxx-appleFrameworkPaths.description: A list of paths to search for Apple Frameworks

target-source-cxx-appleFrameworks.description:
A list of Apple Frameworks to link to the project.

Note: Only the name of the framework is necessary (ex: `Foundation` instead of `Foundation.framework`)

target-source-cxx-precompiledHeader.description: Treat a header file as a pre-compiled header and include it during compilation of every object file in the project. Define a path relative to the workspace root, but it must be contained within a sub-folder (such as `src`).

target-source-cxx-threads.description: true to enable the preferred thread implementation of the compiler, such as pthreads (default), false to disable.

target-source-cxx-cppFilesystem.description: true to enable C++17 filesystem in previous language standards (equivalent to `-lc++-fs`), false to disable (default).

target-source-cxx-cppModules.description: true to enable C++20 modules, false to disable (default).

target-source-cxx-cppCoroutines.description: true to enable C++20 coroutines (equivalent to `-fcoroutines` or `-fcoroutines-ts`), false to disable (default).

target-source-cxx-cppConcepts.description: true to enable C++20 concepts in previous language standards (equivalent to `-fconcepts` or `-fconcepts-ts`), false to disable (default).

target-source-cxx-runtimeTypeInformation.description: true to include run-time type information (default), false to exclude.

target-source-cxx-positionIndependentCod.description: true to use position independent code. In MSVC, this does nothing. in GCC/Clang, `-fPIC` will be added to shared libraries and static libraries that link to shared libraries (within the workspace). `-fPIE` will be added to executables and static libraries that link to executables (within the workspace). Executables in GCC will be linked with `-pie`. This behavior can be set manually with `shared` or `executable` instead. false to disable (default).

target-source-cxx-fastMath.description: true to enable additional (and potentially dangerous) floating point optimizations (equivalent to `-ffast-math`). false to disable (default).

target-source-cxx-exceptions.description: true to use exceptions (default), false to turn off exceptions.

target-source-cxx-inputCharset.description: The character set used by input source files in this target. Default: UTF-8

target-source-cxx-executionCharset.description: The execution character set to be given to the compiler. Default: UTF-8

target-source-cxx-buildSuffix.description:
Describes a suffix used to differentiate targets within build folders. If the same suffix is used between multiple targets, they can share objects and a precompiled header. By default, the suffix is the name of the target, so setting this to the name of another target will share its objects.
Affected paths:
`${buildOutputDir}/obj.${suffix}`
`${buildOutputDir}/asm.${suffix}`

target-source-cxx-staticRuntimeLibrary.description: true to statically link against compiler runtime libraries (libc++, MS UCRT, etc.). false to dynamically link them (default).

target-source-cxx-staticLinks.description: A list of libraries to statically link with the linker. Can be the name of the source target, a link identifier (no extension), or the full relative path to a static library.

target-source-cxx-unityBuild.description: true to automatically build this target as a unity build. false to disable (default). This will combine all included source files into a single compilation unit in the order they're declared in `files`.

target-source-cxx-warningsPreset.description: Either a preset of the warnings to use, or the warnings flags themselves (excluding `-W` prefix)

target-source-cxx-warnings.description: Either a preset of the warnings to use, or the warnings flags themselves (excluding `-W` prefix)

target-source-cxx-treatWarningsAsErrors.description: true to treat all warnings as errors. false to disable (default).

target-source-cxx-windowsApplicationMani.description: The path to a Windows application manifest, or false to disable automatic generation. Only applies to executable (kind=executable) and shared library (kind=sharedLibrary) targets

target-source-cxx-windowsAppIcon.description: The windows icon to use for the project. Only applies to executable targets (kind=executable)

target-source-cxx-mingwUnixSharedLibrary.description: If true (default), shared libraries will use the `lib(name).dll` naming convention in the MinGW toolchain (default), false to use `(name).dll`.

target-source-cxx-justMyCodeDebugging.description: If true (default) on builds with debugging, enables 'Just My Code' in supported debuggers. Disabling this may improve performance in some situations. Currently only supported with MSVC

target-source-cxx-windowsSubSystem.description: The subsystem to use for the target on Windows systems. If not specified, defaults to `console`

target-source-cxx-windowsEntryPoint.description: The type of entry point to use for the target on Windows systems. If not specified, defaults to `main`

kind.description: The type of the target's compiled binary, a script or external project.

target-script-file.description: The relative path to a script file to run.

target-script-arguments.description: A list of arguments to pass along to the script.

target-script-dependsOn.description: A build target or file(s) this script depends on in order to run.

kind.description: The type of the target's compiled binary, a script or external project.

target-process-path.description: Either the full path to an exectuable, or a shell compatible name to be resolved.

target-process-arguments.description: A list of arguments to pass along to the process.

target-process-dependsOn.description: A build target or file(s) this process depends on in order to run.

target-validation.description: Validate JSON file(s) against a schema.

kind.description: The type of the target's compiled binary, a script or external project.

target-validation-schema.description: A JSON schema (Draft 7) to validate files against. File requires the '$schema' key/value.

target-validation-files.description: File(s) to be validated using the selected schema.

kind.description: The type of the target's compiled binary, a script or external project.

target-cmake-location.description: The folder path of the root CMakeLists.txt for the project.

target-cmake-buildFile.description: The build file to use, if not CMakeLists.txt, relative to the location. (`-C` options)

target-cmake-targets.description: A specific CMake target, or targets to build instead of the default (all).

target-cmake-defines.description: Macro definitions to be passed into CMake. (`-D` options)

target-cmake-recheck.description: If true (default), CMake will be invoked each time during the build.

target-cmake-rebuild.description: If true (default), the CMake build folder will be cleaned and rebuilt when a rebuild is requested.

target-cmake-clean.description: If true (default), the CMake build folder will be cleaned when a clean is requested.

target-cmake-toolset.description: A toolset file to be passed to CMake (`-T` option).

target-cmake-runExecutable.description: The path to an executable to run, relative to the build directory.

target-chalet.description: Build target(s) utilizing separate Chalet projects.

kind.description: The type of the target's compiled binary, a script or external project.

target-chalet-location.description: The folder path of the root chalet.json for the project.

target-chalet-buildFile.description: The build file to use, if not chalet.json, relative to the location.

target-chalet-targets.description: A specific Chalet target, or targets to build instead of the default (all).

target-chalet-recheck.description: If true (default), Chalet will be invoked each time during the build.

target-chalet-rebuild.description: If true (default), the Chalet build folder will be cleaned and rebuilt when a rebuild is requested.

target-chalet-clean.description: If true (default), the Chalet build folder will be cleaned when a clean is requested.

settings:Cxx.description:
Settings for compiling C, C++, and Windows resource files.
May also include settings related to linking.

package-settings-cxx.description:
Settings for compiling C, C++, and Windows resource files.
May also include settings related to linking.

platform-requires.description: Define system packages to be verfied before the build begins.

platform-requires-ubuntu-system.description: Ubuntu system packages to be checked before the build.

platform-requires-debian-system.description: Debian system packages to be checked before the build.

platform-requires-archlinux-system.description: Arch Linux system packages to be checked before the build.

platform-requires-manjaro-system.description: Manjaro system packages to be checked before the build.

platform-requires-fedora-system.description: Fedora system packages to be checked before the build.

platform-requires-redhat-system.description: Red Hat system packages to be checked before the build.

platform-requires-windows-msys2.description: Windows MSYS2 packages to be checked before the build.

platform-requires-macos-macports.description: MacOS MacPorts packages to be checked before the build.

platform-requires-macos-homebrew.description: MacOS Homebrew packages to be checked before the build.

abstracts.description: A list of abstract build targets

^(\\*|[A-Za-z\\-_]+)$.description: An abstract build target. '*' is a special target that gets implicitely added to each project.

allowedArchitectures.description: An array of allowed target architecture triples supported by the project. Use this to limit which ones can be used to build the project.

configurations.description: An object of custom build configurations. If one has the same name as a default build configuration, the default will be replaced.

defaultConfigurations.description: An array of allowed default build configuration names.

distribution.description: A sequential list of distribution targets to be created during the bundle phase.

kind.description: Whether the distribution target is a bundle, script, archive, or something platform-specific.

externalDependencies.description: Dependencies to resolve prior to building or via the configure command, that are considered external to this project. The object key will be used as a reference to the resulting location via '${external:(key)}'.

^[\\w\\-+.]{3,100}$.description: A single external dependency or script.

kind.description: Whether the external dependency is a git repository, local folder, or script.

package.description: The interface describing importable packages from this workspace.

targets.description: A sequential list of build targets, cmake targets, or scripts.

^[\\w\\-+.]{3,}$.description: A single build target or script.

kind.description: The type of the target's compiled binary, a script or external project.

^abstracts:(\\*|[A-Za-z\\-_]+)$.description: An abstract build target. 'abstracts:*' is a special target that gets implicitely added to each project
